3: Wanshi stares at the enemy before him. Time seemed to stop momentarily. The air is so quiet; all he can here is his own breath and 'Gear's' footsteps.
Wanshi counts quietly to himself.
Acquiring data. Calculating direction. Adjusting angle.
Wanshi had heard everything Chrome and Kamui had encountered over Strike Hawk's encrypted channel.
He must avenge Troy, fulfill Arnold's wish, and fight for his comrades.
More importantly, he must uphold his faith.
In this solemn era, mankind has made countless sacrifices so that they can return to Earth.
This goal is not in line with his own. He has known that for quite some time.
However, in order to protect those he cares about from sacrificing themselves for this goal, Wanshi's course of action has long been set in stone.
The best he can do right now is to help his comrades and shoot the enemies down, not letting the fallen down, becoming an unyielding flag on the battlefield.
...It's over.
With the combined forces of the Strike Hawk trio, the threat from 'Gear' had finally been neutralized.

Wanshi is like the lynchpin in the Strike Hawk's attack, perfectly complimenting Chrome and Kamui's shortcomings. Although his attacks are not fatal, they are always there precisely when they are needed most.
While 'Gear' was on the defensive, it had forgotten it was fighting three people. Strike Hawk's flawless teamwork had formed into a singular impenetrable wall of attacks.
'Gear's' attack had been decimated. It's defenses had been stripped away.
Don't let up!
Bang—!
Wanshi fires a silver orb of light straight at 'Gear'.
Chrome swings his scythe, imbuing the orb of light with blue electricity.
As calculated, the orb strikes 'Gear's' head where it had been weakened by Kamui's greatsword.
It appears... I underestimated you...
Speaking its last mournful words, 'Gear' collapses onto the ground and stops moving.
Well, this sure was quite the train wreck...
Yawn... You could say that again...
Haha, well least it's over.
Yeah. Now we just need to get our hands on the target, and we can call it a day.
Wanshi slings his sniper rifle over his shoulder and walks toward 'Gear's' remains.
Unbeknownst to the trio, a faint light shines upon them among the lights of the surrounding buildings.
After obtaining the file, Wanshi returns to where he had left Arnold.
But when Wanshi approaches, he discovers that Arnold is missing. Instead, all that remains is the sphere bot and a can of herring.
Wanshi touches the robot, causing Arnold's hologram to project in front of him.
Goodbye, 'human' of the new era.
Maybe it's just me, but...
You are more human than anyone I had ever met in the cities of the Golden Age.
Because you have the passion they don't. You have a 'heart.'
Don't worry about me. I'm just a human from a bygone era.
Those of us who still remain should be scattered in the wind or buried in the dirt along with the times.
In the past, we were cold, weak and fragile.
We were a fraction of what you have become.
You are far more real than anything we ever were.
You can explore space, or take back Earth for yourselves. It doesn't matter.
It's time for you to start an era that belongs to the Constructs.
Take the can I left you as a token from an ol' soul wanderin' adrift. After all, I gotta shake things up a bit, right? Bahaha!
Well, then. See ya 'round, kiddo.
Just as Arnold's message finishes, the sphere bot in Wanshi's hands runs out of power and falls into eternal slumber.
Heh... Does this mean I still owe you?
Wanshi places the robot next to the pressure valve, picks up the can of herring, then looks at Chrome and Kamui as they approach from the distance.
Hey, Wanshi. Let's head back.
...Coming.
The Babylonian transport craft flies into the night sky with a trail of blue flame. The once war-torn city of the Post-Pandemic Age finally returns to tranquil silence.
Once the transport craft disappears, two figures appear from within the city ruins.
They defeated 'Chariot'.
No matter. The file we need has been backed up and sent to the organization.
Its memory shell remembered the mission right before it went offline.
That sure is callous of you to say... My comrade died right before your eyes.
Leaving rusty 'Gears' will only affect the organization's operation. A timely death is the best course of action.
Alright... Fair enough,
Have you finished cleaning up 'Chariot'? Now is not the time to make our presence known to Babylonia.
Of course.
Alas... Erasing knowledge of 'Chariot' from a powerful enemy such as Strike Hawk took considerable effort.
When I get back, upgrade my data circuit to the latest model as a reward.
I'll pass the word along.
Let's go look for 'Sage'. There are still a lot of preparations for the ceremony before it returns.
Alright, alright. Hey, slow down! Wait for me...
